dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole island, from the south.  For a second.  Literal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closer, just the skyline.  For another second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closer still, the Upper West Side.  For another second. time to waste admiring the scenery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Race across a field of PEDESTRIANS to pick up three women hurrying down the sidewalk.  LYDIA LYNCH, a real estate broker, vaults down the sidewalk, she's got a hell of a stride.  MEG ALTMAN, thirtyish, struggles to keep up with her, she's tall, wafer-thin, pale as a ghost.  SARAH, a n year old girl, flat out runs to keep up, dribbling a basketball as she goes.  The kid's athletic, much tougher than Meg, who she resembles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia reads from a sheet she carries in her bouncing hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- seventeen feet wide, fifty-five feet deep, forty-two hundred square feet, four floors with a rentable basement apartment, so five altogether, courtyard in back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you slow down a little? (looking back over her shoulder) Or we could wait for the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No cars.  Feet are faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many more do we have after this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None, there's nothing else, you know how tight the market is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it?  I told you on the phone, I have to be moved in in two weeks.  Sarah, please don't bounce that here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, it's the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that miserable little prick is already leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach a row of brownstones, narrow four story townhouses, nice looking buildings, a hundred years old o more.  EVAN, a sour-looking man, has just locked the fron door of number 26 and is coming down the steps.  He sees coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day you will learn to respect other people's time, Lydia, one day you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, I am so sorry, you were a saint to wait for us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan throws open the front door, revealing the airy foyer the townhouse.  The place is completely empty.  He talks fast, races through the tour.  The three of them come in, Sarah still bouncing her basketball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the middle of the house, the entry floor, living room's over there.  The kitchen floor's below us and there's two bedroom floors above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door closes behind them, with a THUD so authoritative it seems to say no one's ever getting out. tries to get her daughter's attention, to tell her to sto bouncing the ball in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an enormous amount of space for the money and I'll be perfectly honest, the family is in no hurry whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg whispers Sarah's name, but Sarah still ignores her, g on bouncing the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to tell you there is an acute shortage of living space in Manhattan right now and this is a highly unique property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ball, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah immediately stops bouncing.  She wanders into the living room, peers through the big French doors, which lo out over the courtyard area.  There's another row of brownstones on the next block, and all the patios back up one another.  It looks tranquil out there, oasis in the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah leans up against the door, sighs, her breath fogs t window.  There is a profound melancholy about her.  Meg watches her, tries to catch eyes with her in the reflecti Can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan flings open the door of an old-fashioned cage-style elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working elevator.  Mr. Pearlstine, the previous owner, was disabled the last ten years of his life.  Highly unusual, the elevator, you will not find this in ninety percent of brownstones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will they take asking price?  I need a two week escrow and I'm already approved for the loan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia turns, gives Meg an "are you insane?" look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What say we see the house before we dicker, hmm? (starting up the stairs) I have to warn you, this is exactly the response we expected to get. It's a very emotional property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he disappears upstairs, Lydia turns to Meg, lowers her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who taught you to negotiate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like Saks', Mom, you don't have to pay the price on the tag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets in the elevator and RATTLES the door shut with a bang.  That kid's got an attitude.  Meg takes a deep brea turns to Lydia.  She brushes her hair behind an ear, we notice her thin hand is shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  Apartments, and... money, and... this is more my husband's area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She digs in her purse for a prescription pill bottle and water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was.  His area.  I'm not very good at...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia watches as she swallows a pill, waiting for Meg to finish her sentence.  Not very good at what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things, and if I can't prove to my soon to-be ex-husband that I can provide a suitable place for our daughter to live in the next fourteen days, it's going to get ugly between us.  Uglier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia just looks at her, no idea what to say.  These two from different places.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from upstairs) It would be so lovely if I could shot the property before I leave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, Lydia, and Meg poke their heads in a series of room one after the other, the tour flying by quickly.  First, upstairs bedroom.  Nice, roomy, looks out on the courtyar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top floor.  Two bedrooms, one bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another floor, another empty room.  The trio passes throu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third floor, spare bedroom, den, what have you.  Mr. Pearlstine used it as an office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low voice, to Meg) He's talking about Bernard Pearlstine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg shrugs, who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving, through a bathroom) Master bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hotel guy?  It's been in the papers lately.  His kids are all suing each other over his estate. He was a total recluse, paranoid, rich as hell, he was worth thirty million or something, now it turns out they can't find half of it. (singsong) Somebody took something didn't belong to them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hardly see how family gossip is germane to showing the property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, to Meg) Stop calling it the property, you sound ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through a closet) Master closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the hallway, there is a GROANING METALLIC sound, the elevator, and the happy laughter of the little girl as sh puts it through its paces.  Evan winces, speaks as if his mouth hurts when he moves it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could the child please stop that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KID!  NO ELEVATOR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Meg and winks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we emerge in the master bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg looks around, studying the dimensions of the room.  S looks at the far wall, the one that borders the house nex door.  She looks at the wall that corners it, opposite th window wall.  She takes two steps back from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, doesn't that corner seem funny to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to the far end of the wall, near the entrance the closet.  There is a mirrored door that leads to the closet, and a mirror on the wall alongside it.  If you lo closely, you'll see that the mirrors are raked slightly toward one another, which causes an optical illusion in w the corner of the room appears much closer to the door th it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was waiting to see if you'd notice!  On caravan, no one from our office had the slightest idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes on the top of the mirror on the wall.  It makes faint CLICK, then glides open a few inches off the wall. pulls it toward him, opens it all the way, a hundred eigh degrees, and it fastens magnetically to the back of the closed door.  There is smooth wall behind it, but if you closely, there is a faint vertical crack in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg looks at him -- what in the world?  Even pushes again twice this time, first at the top, then at the bottom, an the smooth wall CLICKS ajar.  He pulls it wide open.  Meg Lydia step forward, fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the opposite end of a lone, narrow, windowless space see the three of them standing in the open doorway, silhouetted by the sunlight streaming through the bedroom windows behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called a panic room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits a switch and a row of bulbs flick on overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A safe room.  An inner sanctum.  A castle keep, in medieval times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I've seen these...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quite in vogue in high end construction right now.  One really can't be too careful about home invasion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other two walk inside, but Meg lingers near the door, looking around, studying the neatly arrayed survival supp -- water, food packs, batteries, flashlights, tools, rope clothes, blankets -- you get the idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, this is perfect for you... (Meg scoffs) Absolutely!  You're a woman, you're living alone now.  Your alarm goes off, or you head glass break, or for whatever reason you think someone's broken into your home in the middle of the night.  What are you going to do?  Call the police and wait until they get here on Tuesday?  Traipse downstairs in your sexy little underthings and check it out?  I think not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reinforced steel core walls.  Buried phone line, completely separate, not connected to the house's main line and never exposed throughout the house's infrastructure or outside the house -- you can call the police; nobody can cut you off. Your own ventilation system, complete with oxygen scrubber, so you've got plenty of fresh air for as long as you like.  And a bank of video monitors --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits a switch next to a dozen tiny video monitors, revealing a dozen different views of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- covering almost every corner of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg nods, starting to sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes me nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever read any Poe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so, but I love her album.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Edgar Allen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks) The furniture guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving up) What's to keep them from prying open the door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan reaches past Meg and pushes a red button on the wall behind her.  With a sudden WHANG of steel, a heavy metal leaps out of a slot in the wall and SLAMS shut, like a submarine hatch.  A series of metal latches CLICK into pl inside it, from top to bottom, securing it into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steel, four inches thick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg takes a step back.  They're now enclosed in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's spring-loaded, even if the power's out it's fully functional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Bernie didn't miss a trick with this room, did he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with kids like he's got, no wonder he wanted a place to hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's highly inappropriate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan hits a green button and the door GROANS slowly open, recoiling its massive spring, and revealing Sarah, the li girl, standing in the entryway, grinning widely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My room.  Definitely my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bolts in, just as her mother bolts out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg stands just outside the door to the panic room, regai her composure.  Not crazy about tight spaces.  Which we already knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That door is a safely hazard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points.  There's a tiny red beam that shines across th doorway, one at shoulder height --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Infrared.  Like the beam in an elevator doorway.  Won't let the door close if something's blocking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and one at shin height.  Even bend down, blocks the on shin height with his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches up, to push the close button, but with one han anchored at the floor, he can't quite reach it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lydia) Push that button for me, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia pushes the close button, nothing happens.  Evan pul his hand put of the beam, takes a step back.  Lydia pushe the button again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHANG!  The metal door rockets shut, the metallic slang reverberating in the room.  Almost immediately, the fake piece of wall HUMS shut, of its own accord, followed a mo later by the mirror, which detaches itself from the back the closet door and HUMS silently back into place, closin over the hidden door, making the corner of the room look a corner again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the mirrored door closes, it shows Meg her own reflect She looks at herself, still rattled.  She wipes a trickle sweat from the side of her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same house, two weeks later.  The entry floor is pile high with moving boxes.  Sarah and Meg lie sprawled out i the middle of the black and white tile, arms and legs spl wide, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare up at the ceiling, beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too many stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got us in here, didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoulda got an apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I know that now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg raises her hand to her face, she's got her cell phone her palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Battery's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg picks up the wall phone in the kitchen, gets a dial t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone works. (to Sarah) Hey, I hooked up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) The crowd goes wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring the slight) 478...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg finishes dialing.  It rings, someone answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perry's Pizza, please hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night has fallen.  Meg and Sarah sit at a small table in middle of the kitchen, surrounded by packing boxes.  They pizza.  They chew, silently.  Sarah drinks a diet Dr. Pepper.  Meg finishes a glass of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg's eyes are moist.  Sarah notices.  She notices her noticing, shrugs.  I'm human, what do you want me to do, it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah looks away, goes back to chewing.  After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck her too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg looks at her, not sure how to confront the open defia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree.  But don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah stares at her for a moment, then goes back to eatin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg picks up the bottle of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah's eyes flick over and watch as wine GLUGS into her mother's glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah's bedroom is full of unpacked boxes, but her twin b has been set up and Sarah is in it, hair wet, pajamas on. She reads from a book ("Tom Swift and His Repelatron Skyw while Meg, drowsy, lies next to her, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Tom's throat felt so dry and tight that it was a moment before he could make any sound come out.  "Dad!" He croaked.  "I'm - inside - the - machine!" "Great Scott!"  The elder scientist gasped.  He dashed across the laboratory and switched off the repelatron's motor.  "What happened, son?" "The Durafoam hardened, Dad. Get a solvent, quick -- you know the formula!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the master bathroom, Meg soaks in a bath.  She is exhausted.  She reaches for her wine glass, finishes the of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stretches for the bottle, which is on the floor next her.  She refills the glass.  Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg, dressed in an old Knicks T-shirt and boxer shorts, stands next to the alarm panel in the master bedroom, rea from an instruction manual.  She's frustrated.  She mutte slurring, a bit drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bypass non-ready zones... shunt, enter, zone number...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries it, pushing a few buttons, but the alarm panel BEEPS at her disapprovingly.  She's doing something wrong

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sighs, sits on the floor, gets serious about figuring the instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bypass non-ready zones... ah, shunt, enter, shunt again, zone number... wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: dance over the alarm panel, some time later.  She seems t have figured it out, and a small light on the panel light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The very moment the red light goes on, we cut sharply to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the darkened panic room, where the dozen small video screens all suddenly wink to life, showing a dozen views the house.  Whatever she pushed turned these on too, prob not what she meant to do, but at least she got the alarm for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door that leads from the panic room to the master bed hangs open.  In the middle of the floor in here, somebody made a small tent of blankets and couch cushions.  Sarah have been playing here before bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg puts sheets on her bed in the master bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fills a glass of water, puts it on a box she's using a night table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She plugs in a battery charger for her cell phone, places phone in the cradle.  It BEEPS.  "Charging."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sets the digital clock, puts it next to the glass of water.  It's 12:26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets in bed, her side, the left side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lies in the dark, half an acre of empty bed across fr her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We drift off her, see the clock again.  The time changes, number one dissolves away, changing the time to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- 2:26.  Meg is in a hard, boozy sleep.  We drift out th door of the master bedroom, into the third floor hallway, down the open stairwell.  We glide through the entry floo still gently falling through the stairwell's airway, drop even further, all the way down to the kitchen floor, the ground floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We drift across the darkened kitchen, serpentine through canyon of moving boxes, approach the window that looks ou the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move right up against the window, peer through the gla just as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a van pulls up across the street and stops.  Can't see through its windows.  No movement for a moment, then the driver's door opens and a MAN climbs out.  He wears dark clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man closes the door, looks both ways, and starts acro the street towards us.  He's carrying a bag of some kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to the door, and we drift down toward the doorkno We hear a key slide into the door, rattle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the lock doesn't turn.  The key slides out, back in again, jiggles.  Still won't open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man steps away from the door, goes to the kitchen win which is heavily barred, and peers inside, right at us. Can't see anything, it's darker in here than it is out th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, looks both ways on the street again, then steps onto the window ledge.  Now we can only see his legs, can tell what he's doing.  He's reaching up, stretching for something.  It drops into view with a metallic SCRAPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man climbs, his feet disappearing from our field of vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We turn around, facing the other way in the kitchen.  We start back the way we came, through the canyon of boxes i the kitchen, toward the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the stairwell, the exact reverse of the shot we s earlier.  We're drifting up, off the kitchen floor, throu the entry floor, and as we rise we notice something all t way up on the roof that we couldn't see before, when we w looking down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A skylight.  We continue to rise, drawn toward it.  We mo up, through the master bedroom floor, creeping up alongsi the stair banister, now reaching the top floor of the hou and just as we near the skylight --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a figure appears, visible through it.  The Man in dark clothes, on the roof now.  He stops, peers down through t skylight, looking at us without seeing us again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps across the skylight.  This is not the way he int to enter.  We drift again, following his soft footsteps o the roof, which we can hear faintly through the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here in the hall, just outside Sarah's bedroom, a closet is ajar.  We squeeze through the gap and into the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it's completely dark.  Can't see a thing.  But then a sli of light appears, coming from above.  We look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a ladder that's bolted to the wall in this close it leads up to a square panel in the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roof access.  And that roof access panel is moving, ever slightly, moonlight spilling in as it twists in its setti A shiny silver something slides through the crack along t edges of the portal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It slithers along the edge of the hatchway, searching for something.  It finds a small round nub in the crack.  The silver something stops.  It HUMS with electricity for a moment, then there is a bright spark and a soft CRACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the master bedroom, a message appears on the alarm pan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the closet, the silver something withdraws and the roo access panel is removed.  A million stars are visible in night sky above.  But we're inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in a moment, so is this intruder.  The Man peers down through the open hatchway, then slips through the opening climbs silently down the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In bed, Meg stirs.  An alcohol sleep is a restless one, a she's suffering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits up groggily, chugs a glass of water.  Lies down again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One floor up, the Man steps into the hallway and starts f the stairs, moving quickly and confidently.  Knows where going, knows what he wants.  He starts down the stairs, happens to glance to the side as he does so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He freezes.  He's looking in the open doorway of the top floor bathroom, staring hard at something that clearly disturbs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nightlight.  Plugged into an outlet in the baseboard in bathroom.  (For the record, it's the Power Puff Girls.) Man climbs the stairs again, concerned, goes to the door the bathroom.  He looks from the nightlight to the countertop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a moving box on the countertop.  His eyes widen. This is news to him, bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a step back and a breath.  He turns, looks to th end of the hall.  His eyes now adjusted to the darkness, notices something he didn't see before, something coming under the door to the fourth floor bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light.  From inside.  From another nightlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the top floor bedroom, a nightlight burns in another outlet.  Nearby, Sarah is asleep in bed, the covers kicke off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to Sarah's bedroom glides open, terribly slowly. The Man stands in the doorway, staring, aghast, at the mountain of moving boxes piled in the room.  His gaze fal on Sarah in the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man just stares, beside himself.  His lips mouth a wo soundlessly.  Doesn't take a lip reader to guess it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the master bedroom, Meg flops over in bed, facing away from the doorway, really having a rough go of it.  She sl too hard before, now she's awake, her head is killing her she's really paying the price of four glasses of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lies still, on her side, facing us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind her, the bedroom door moves, silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man stands there, one finger still on the door he's j pushed open.  He stares at the sleeping form of Meg on th bed, whose back is to him.  He has no idea she's awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg lies in bed, eyes wide open, no idea a Man is standin the doorway to her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noiselessly, the Man moves away, down the hall.  The mome his head disappears down the stairwell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Meg flops over again, facing the doorway.  She closes eyes, gives sleep another try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man walks across the kitchen, shaking his head in exasperation at the packing boxes all around him.  He goe the front window, peers outside.  He reaches for a light switch on his right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window, we can see the stoop light go on.  Th off, then on and off again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still through the window, we see the side panel door of t van slide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO MORE MEN climb out.  They are also dressed in dark clothes.  They also carry satchels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walks calmly across the street, grow large in the wi as they approach us.  The first intruder (who has a name, it's BURNHAM) steps over to the kitchen door, runs his silvery strip through the gap.  Another HUM and spark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: flashes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham opens the kitchen door, letting the two other guy slip inside.  RAOUL is a hulking figure whose back seems rise up over the top of his slouching head; when he walks looks like gravity does all the work, just pulling him forward.  JUNIOR is much smaller, very high-strung, dress like a homey, very street, but can't hide the fact that t street is Park Avenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all freeze, staring at the moving boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman and a little girl, both asleep upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your voice down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not supposed to be here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was your department, Junior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not supposed to be here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why the key didn't work, they changed the locks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen day escrow, man, that's almost three weeks!  They shouldn't be here for another week!  They don't own this house yet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) Exactly how is fourteen days almost three weeks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen business days.  Escrow is always business days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, right?  Isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul steps forward, shoves Burnham with both hands in th chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Raoul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Junior) Who is this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul is cool.  That's all you need to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is insane.  I'm outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, wait a minute.  We can still handle this. (to Raoul) Can we still handle this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just the woman and the kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless Daddy comes back later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy's not coming back, she's in the middle of a divorce, it's just the two of them.  We're okay, here. (to Raoul) We can do this, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fuckin' A we can do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not with me.  Not with people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty-five minutes.  That's all you said you need.  That's like nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll call the cops, they'll be here before I get unpacked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we keep an eye on her.  Raoul can totally administrate that part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want Raoul to administrate that part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about us?  What if she has a gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul, what in God's name do we do if she has a gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul pulls up his sweatshirt, revealing a .38 tucked int his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy shows you a gun, Burnham, and you insult him?  Hey, who's the idiot?  Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get this clown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met him at the tables, same as you.  And frankly, I'm grateful we have a little muscle right about now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What tables?  I've never seen him before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different tables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Raoul) The fuck did you bring a gun for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peace out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves for the door.  Junior, trying desperately to hol this together, gets there first, blocks the door with his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't do it without you, Burnham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior starts at Burnham.  Raoul stares at Burnham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still a good plan.  It's just... got a twist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Kidnapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if we keep 'em here.  You can't kidnap somebody in their own house. It's just breaking and entering, unless we take 'em someplace.  Or something like that, I'm pretty sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pure idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.  I'm an idiot's son.  An idiot's grandson.  I'm third- generation idiot.  But for once in my life I had a good idea, and I'm not giving up so easy.  You are? Are you actually telling me that for the first time in your life you're gonna throw your cards on the table and go home early?  I can't believe my eyes. (Burnham hesitates) Fourteen million dollars upstairs, Burnham.  You'll be out of the hole. Baby, you'll be so far out of the hole you could draw bricks every night for the next twenty years and still shit green. (Burnham sways) Come on, Buddy.  One more hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg sits up in bed.  She's bleary, her head feels like someone rested a manhole cover on it.  She gets up, in th dark, and staggers off toward the bathroom door, feeling way with her arms, her eyes not adjusted to the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks into the bathroom and feels around for a light switch, but can't find it.  She blinks, squints, tries to her bearings.  The only light is a harsh white glow that comes from along one wall, from a bank of tiny video monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds the light switch, flicks it on, it nearly blind her.  She's not in the bathroom.  She's wandered into the panic room by mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns around, walks out, leaving the lights on behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We linger for a look at the video screens.  If only she'd done the same, she'd see what we see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we see the three men, still in the kitchen, huddled in a group, silently debating what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using the light that spills from the open door to the pan room, Meg comes back into the master bedroom and finds th proper door to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg SNAPS the cap off a jug of Advil and dumps three into palm.  She pops them in her mouth, searches for a glass f water, finds none, bends to the spout for a gulp to wash down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the monitor, we see the three men leave the kitchen an start up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg stands, flushes the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One floor down, Burnham, Raoul, and Junior freeze, just coming up the stairs from the kitchen.  They look up, hea the water rushing through the pipes in the ceiling direct above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at the ceiling, following with their eyes as a pair of feet pad across the CREAKY floor.  Finally, they a SQUEAK of bedsprings as Meg climbs back into bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hold a moment longer, a silence grows.  Raoul reache into his jacket pocket and pulls out a ski mask.  He pull over his head.  They look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) No face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham rolls his eyes.  Doesn't know this guy much, but hates him so far.  They start across the foyer toward the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg rolls over, to go back to sleep.  She sees she's left lights on in the panic room.  She TSKS, gets out of bed, walks across the floor toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg steps into the panic room, raises her hand to the lig switch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and stops, her hand frozen in mid-air.  She cocks her head, looking at something she can't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She blinks.  Takes a step, further into the room.  She st at the video monitors -- at the three men in dark clothes stealing silently across the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't be.  These are just pictures, they have no relation to reality.  She drops to her knees, her face in from the screens, and reaches out to touch them, as if tr to make sure they're really there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the base of the stairs, Junior in the lead.  A reaches a bend at the base of the stairs, he places one f short on an angled step and it slips off.  He trips, fall forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching the video monitors, Meg stares in horror as the image of Junior slipping is verified by the SLAP of his h on the stairs as he catches himself, audible through the door to the panic room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She GASPS.  It is real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the living room, Burnham's eyes are wide as saucers, staring at Junior as he turns and pulls himself to his fe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior points at Raoul, speaks in an urgent whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top floor, get the little girl and keep her there.  I'll bring the woman up.  Gimme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out his hand for the gun and Raoul gives it to h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to Burnham) Stay here.  Nobody gets past you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads for the stairs.  Raoul follows close behind him. Burnham stays, reluctant -- what the fuck has he gotten himself into?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg moves.  Leaps to her feet and dashes out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg races across her bedroom, flies out the door, and bol up the carpeted stairs, headed for the top floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg races into Sarah's room, drops onto the bed, and grab Sarah by the shoulders, trying to rouse her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up... wake up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's in a profound child's sleep and won't wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One floor down, Junior and Raoul reach the third floor landing.  Still moving stealthily, Junior heads down the for the master bedroom, where he thinks Meg is sleeping. Raoul heads for the stairs that lead to the top floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg is desperate, still can't wake Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up...come on, come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees a plastic cup on her night table/box, half fille with water.  She snatches it and tosses the water in her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she's awake.  And pissed off.  She SPUTTERS, SHOUTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT DID YOU DO THAT FOR?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul, at the base of the stairs that lead to the top flo hears the kid shouting.  He starts up the stairs, quickly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the top floor, Meg is already dragging Sarah out of th room and into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg and Sarah come out of Sarah's bedroom just as Raoul reaches the top of the stairs at the other end.  They're off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg freezes, staring at the hulking ski-masked figure at end of the hallway.  She thinks, no idea what to do for a second.  She looks frantically to her right -- the bathro dead end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks to her left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She yanks open the elevator door, throws aside the gate, races inside with Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul takes off down the hall, lunging for the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg SLAMS the gate shut and PUNCHES the button for the fi floor.  The elevator GROANS to life and starts down -- slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah looks up at her, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People.  In the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the elevator descends, they see Raoul, through the win in the door, as he drops to his knees, to get a good look them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul turns from the elevator, SHOUTS to the open stairwe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE ELEVATOR!  BOTH OF 'EM HEADED TOWARD YOU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior turns from the open doorway of the master bedroom races back down the hall, toward the elevator.  He reache the door, peers through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees the bare feet of Meg and Sarah, dropping toward h He grabs the door handle, pulls as hard as he can, but it stays locked, with the elevator moving beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bangs on the button, hoping the elevator will stop.  A Meg and Sarah drop fully into view, he stands there, eye moving eye with her for a moment.  But the elevator doesn stop, it keeps going down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg stands frozen, terrified, staring at Junior as they m past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior has another go at the door, pulling as hard as he actually bending the door, but the elevator is still movi the catch holds fast and the door won't open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they pass, his face suddenly disappears, he takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior flies down the stairs, to cut them off at the firs floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PANIC ROOM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg thinks, then punches the button for three, to go back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the elevator continues down.  She jabs at it, futilel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  you gotta...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches past her, pushes the STOP button.  The elevat jerks to a halt.  Then Sarah pushes three.  Now the eleva starts to rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg looks at her, impressed.  Love that kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the foyer, Junior freezes, hearing the elevator stop a start again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHE'S COMING BACK UP TOWARD YOU!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes off up the stairs again.  Burnham can't take it anymore, he takes off after Junior, following him upstair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul, still on the top floor, heads for the stairs, fast

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior races back up the stairs.  They have her caught in middle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the elevator BANGS open on three, the gate RATTLES aside, and Meg and Sarah leap out.  They take off down the hall, toward the doorway to the master bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul flies down the stairs, not twenty feet behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg and Sarah run through the master bedroom.  As she pas the night table, Sarah swings an open hand to grab her ce phone from its cradle.  But in her haste she starts to pu it out at an angle and the prongs at the bottom stick in charger.  The phone slips from her fingers, bounces off t corner of the table, caroms off her foot, and skitters un the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah turns, looks to the head of the stairs just as Juni turns the corner and Raoul thunders down the steps from f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She abandons the phone, grabs Sarah, and they lunge throu the open doorway to the panic room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior and Raoul burst through the doorway to the bedroom just a few steps away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg and Sarah trip over each other coming through the doorway, they tumble to the floor of the panic room, the wide open behind them.  Meg spins around, hurls herself a the red button on the wall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Junior leaps, sailing through the air toward them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Meg SLAMS her open palm on the red button, the massive coiled spring that holds the metal door open is released, steel barrier leaps forward out of the wall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and WHANGS shut in a split-second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior SLAMS into the closing metal door, banging his shoulder into it, and slithers to the ground, too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg rolls over and pulls Sarah into her arms, both of the breathing hard, asking each other if they're okay, scared of their minds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spots the telephone, the one with the special buried phone line.  She lunges for it, snatches it from its crad listens for a dial tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing there either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't work?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different phone line, I never hooked it up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hurls it down, looks back at Sarah.  She seems a bit pale, scared.  She goes to her, holds her, reassures her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior is slumped at the base of the door, livid, in pain pounding on it with his fists, screaming "NO!" over and o again, crazy with rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul stands in the middle of the room, chest heaving, ha on his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham finally walks into the room and stops in the door looks from Raoul to Junior to the door to the panic room, figures out the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me... tell me they're not in there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We rise up, above them, above the room, looking down on t the rats-in-a-maze shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We rise up further still, above where the ceiling ought t be, to look down on this room and the one beside it, the behind the four inches of reinforced steel, the panic roo which Meg and Sarah kneel in the middle of the floor, hol each other tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very close on the metal door, from inside the panic room. ear moves slowly into frame, presses against the cold ste Listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg pulls away from the door, shaking her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't hear a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do they want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Rob us.  I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits back against a wall, looks around, at the tiny r She's trying not to show how freaked out she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if they get in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't.  They can't get in here. No.  They can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She checks her wristwatch, for some reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The implications being, worry about yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah crawls over to the bank of video monitors, studies them.  Meg crawls over to join her.  They scan the screen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: there are a dozen different views of the house.  Front st Kitchen.  Dining room.  Entry floor.  Living room.  Maste bedroom.  Den.  Top floor bedrooms, both of them.  Top tw floor hallways.  Even one with a shot of the inside of th elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three intruders are gathered in the living room, stan in a tight circle, having a hell of an argument.  Lots of gesturing, fingers jabbing in chests, but we can't hear a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg furrows her brow, noticing something interesting to t right of the video monitors.  She slides over, studies a panel there with sixteen different buttons and a small grilled area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah joins her, looks at the buttons.  Each one is label with a different room name -- den, kitchen, master bedroo etc.  Up in the corner there is a button that says "ALL PAGE," down in the opposite corner there's a button marke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg looks at Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg is reluctant, frightened.  Sarah is encouraging, for first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg leans forward, clears her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham, Raoul, and Junior are standing in the half-darke living room, in the middle of their argument, when a VOIC booms around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They practically jump out of their shoes, looking around the source of the voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police are on their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only Burnham has remained relatively calm.  After he gets over the initial shock, he walks toward the tiny camera that's hidden in an upper corner of the living room wall stares up at it.  Raoul, who has taken off his ski mask, careful to move out of the camera's range, and turn his b to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suggest you leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham looks up at the camera and shakes his head, waggi finger from side to side.  He raises a hand, makes a gest like a telephone, then wags his finger again.  The messag clear -- you don't have a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg is puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd he know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She presses the talk button again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into speaker) Take what you want and get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounded fairly tough.  She looks at the monitor agai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the three of them have an urgent, whispered conference, t they all start patting their pockets for some reason, tur in circles, looking for something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg and Sarah watch them, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham holds up a finger to the camera -- wait a second while Raoul and Junior rush off screen, looking for something.  Junior returns a moment later holding somethi and the three of them hunch over a box, working on someth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, they break apart and Junior steps up to t camera holding a pad of paper.  He shows it to the camera On the top page, in big block letters, they've written.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a suitable pause for reading, he turns to the secon page, where four more words are written.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah GASPS, Meg sits back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "What we want is in that room."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming in here, aren't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I told you, they can't.  It's not a possibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angry, she sits forward and jabs the talk button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into speaker) What do you know about this room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: there is more frenzied writing, more arguing, and a first draft of a response torn up.  Finally, Junior steps forwa with another sign:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg's confidence is ebbing, but she doesn't want to show She hits the talk button again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into speaker) We're not coming out.  We're not letting you in.  Get out of my house. (clicks off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into speaker) Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Get the fuck out of my house."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into speaker) Get the fuck out of my house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She clicks off again, looks to Sarah for approval, and ge it, sort of, in Sarah's half-smile.  But Sarah's eyes go to the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg follows Sarah's eyes back to the screen, where anothe message is being held up for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the notepad says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg and Sarah speak at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the living room, her voice booms from the speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conversation's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With an audible CLICK, she signs off.  Burnham, Raoul, an Junior stand arrayed beneath the camera, staring up at it dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got her right where you want her, Junior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you said you'd let 'em go I thought she'd come running right out for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and let me think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens a pack of cigarettes, takes out a joint and ligh it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid to let you think, Junior. Things get worse when you think. (sniffs) Oh, that's gonna help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding in a hit) Okay, fuckball, you think.  What are we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if she called the cops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said she did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lied.  Cops woulda been here by now if she called 'em.  Besides, Junior cut the phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham goes to the window and stares outside.  He laughs covers his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is funny about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is not one thing funny here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else but God could think this shit up?  I spend ten years building those fucking rooms to keep people out, now I gotta figure out how to get in.  God, man, He just loves the irony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Yes, it's all terrible ironic and amusing.  You fuck.  Now how are you gonna get us into that room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't.  Whole point.  Can't get in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what the fuck are we supposed to do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make her come out.  And when she does, that's when we gotta be careful.  She can't get out of this house.  She can't even think she can get out of this house.  We just keep them here and keep them quiet for forty-five minutes.  And I don't want (Raoul) Joe Pesci here standing over them with his fat sweaty finger on the trigger.  That's a sure way for us to end up with two dead bodies and little puffs of smoke burning out of our heads up in Greenhaven.  So we're gonna seal the place up.  They wanna hole up in here?  Fine, we'll help 'em.  Make it impossible for them to leave.  Once they come out of that room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why exactly would they want to come out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the window, Burnham notices something sitting just out the French doors, on the balcony.  It's a large outdoor barbecue grill.  He thinks, takes a step closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees a white five gallon tank of some kind underneath grill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Workin' on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the panic room, Meg is sitting cross-legged on the flo leaning against a wall, but Sarah is in motion, sorting through shelves, opening drawers.  Every drawer has somet in it, sealed under plastic.  She opens and closes, sorts lifts finds the following:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waterproof matches and lighters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unopened packages of batteries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sealed water bags stamped "PURE FIVE YEARS FROM DATE."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tinned food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pillows, fireproof blankets (we know because the bags are stamped FIREPROOF BLANKET).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A complete tool kit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sarah explores, she discovers something in the far wal the end of the room, down on the floor at eye level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a small round portal, about eight inches across, wit four-pronged cloverlike seal.  The portal is closed tight Sarah pokes and scrapes at it idly with a finger or two, resists her attempts to crank it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  Relax, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Sarah keeps at it, feels along the edges of the porta then all along the wall, looking for some kind of hidden switch that controls it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it, lie down.  You get your adrenaline up and you know what's gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah stops, looks at her mother, who is pale and wan, huddled in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you freaking out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little bit.  Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small space?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, fast) Don't though. (talk about it, that is)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah looks at her, thinks.  It's not an unfamiliar situation, her needing to comfort her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did the chicken cross the road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I, a five year old?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did the chicken cross the road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To prove he wasn't chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg tries to push a smile across her face, but it's immediately dashes as she looks back at the video screens Her eyes show alarm, staring at the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The contents of one of the satchels is dumped out over th kitchen counter, every kind of tool imaginable, many that unfamiliar to us.  They sort through the pile, choosing things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the French doors that lead to the garden, Burnham has cordless screwdriver and a pile of long screws in his han He reaches up, drills a screw through the door, into the corner of the door frame.  He does the same at the bottom the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unlocks the doorknob, tries it.  The screws hold the d fast.  He moves on, to the next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the panic room, Meg stares at the video screens, eyes wide, terrified.  She watches them.  Can't take her eyes them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely audible) ... locking us in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the library, in the front of the house, Raoul screws s a window, driving the long screws into its frame.  He loo out at the street, at two CLUBGOERS walking home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the drape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg's hands are over her mouth, she's trembling, shaking head from side to side.  This can't be happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the kitchen, Junior goes to the wall phone Meg used to call for pizza earlier.  He cuts the phone wire with a knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands there, staring at the phone, wiping the sweat f his palms on his pants.  Not satisfied, he pulls the phon itself out of the wall, cuts the cord for the handset too

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg pushes herself back into the corner of the panic room horrified.  Sweat has broken out on her forehead, her who body seems to vibrate.  Sarah comes over, leans in front her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Sarah's voice is hollow, seems far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg looks at her.  As she watches, Sarah floats away from her.  In fact, the entire room is floating away from her, elongating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And narrowing.  Meg looks to the sides, and the walls don just seem like they're pushing in on her, they are pushin on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg opens her mouth, screams, but no sound comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah stands up and bends over her, but now she's just a figure far away, all the way at the end of a long, imposs narrow hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely heard) MOM?!  MOM!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg crawls out, into the middle of that hallway, to get a from the wall, but they both continue moving in on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here... not here... someplace else... someplace else...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes roll back into her head, we see just the whites, she loses her balance, falling over onto her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We fall with her, move in tight on her face, and the dark hallway carpet beneath it turns to green, all green, gras green.  She sits up, looks around, and we realize she is fact somewhere else, she's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- in the middle of the Great Lawn, in Central Park.  She stands, turns in a circle, she's completely alone on the great green grassy plain in the middle of a beautiful spr day, tall buildings sparkling in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg stretches her arms out, smiles, but far off in the distance, she hears a voice calling to her, dimly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?!  Mom!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg ignores the voice, she's so happy to be out here, out the open, in the beautiful wide open, she could stay here forever, she spins around, throws her head back, but ther that voice again, insistent:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, please!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is the sharp sound of a SLAP, and Meg's face abrupt jerks to the side.  She touches her cheek, confused, as a red handprint rises up on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the perfect spring day is shattered suddenly by a deafening CRUNCH.  The smile vanishes from Meg's face, sh turns.  Where did that come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM!  Another one, even louder.  Meg's whole body winces the sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM!  A third one, and on this one Meg falls to her knees covering her ears, walls spring up around her, right ther the Great Lawn, we rush in on her, the walls close in, an she's right back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- in the panic room, where she always was, and that poun is real, it's right outside the door, it's like somebody' trying to smash their way right through the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is right over Meg, holding her by the arms, and tha handprint on Meg's face is real, Sarah must have slapped to try to bring her out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEY'RE COMING IN!  THEY'RE COMING IN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg looks to the wall, watches it seem to vibrate as anot deafening BANG crunches into it from outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM!  BAM!  BAM!  The sound is deafening.  Sarah throws b hands over her ears.  Meg looks around, still disoriented

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU CAN'T DO THAT!  YOU CAN'T FREAK OUT LIKE THAT!  YOU HAVE TO STAY HERE WITH ME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.  I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU HAVE TO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here.  I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They huddle there, terrified.  Meg blinks, wipes the swea from her forehead, begins to come back around.  She turns head, sneaks a look at the funny wristwatch Sarah wears, tries to look without her daughter knowing.  It's not an ordinary watch, it only has one number, a tall, flashing digital display:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg nods, as if reassuring herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fine.  We're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, looks at the video monitors to see what the he they're doing out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the master bedroom, a claw hammer CRUNCHES into the sheetrock on the outer wall of the panic room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The intruders are in the master bedroom now, and Burnham like a man possessed, tearing at the sheetrock with the s end of the tool while Junior shines a flashlight into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the sheetrock tears away, we see the skeleton of the w behind it.  There's a latticework of two by four studs, a beyond those the dull shine of the wall's metal core.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's not what he's after.  He continues tearing, reveals an air duct running through the wall, feeding int the panic room through a welded hole in the steel.  Burnh tears away with the hammer, exposing a short section of t duct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLANG!  The claw hammer drops into an opened toolbox. Burnham drops to his knees, rips open another tool case. This one has a sophisticated looking power drill in it, a with a couple dozen specialized bits.  He selects one, tw it into the drill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the wall, Burnham puts drill to metal and hits the swi A horrendous METAL SCREECH fills the air and the drill bi tears into the duct, opening up a jagged hole about the s of a quarter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul hurries through the doorway of the bedroom, carryin coiled garden hose.  Burnham snaps his fingers for it, Ra tosses it to him, holding one end, and the hose uncoils i the air as it snakes across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham shoves the end of the garden hose into the hole h just drilled in the air duct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RIP!  He tears off a length of duct tape and seals the connection, makes it airtight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLIT!  Using a large hunting knife, Raoul hacks a ten foo section of the garden hose off the coil. He stretches it out, across the room, to the white five gallon tank we saw before, which is now sitting on the fl up here.  We move in close as Burnham snugs the cut end o the garden hose over a spigot at the top of the tank.  Re block letters are easy to read on the side of the tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Along with a number of other dire warnings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham raises his hand to the knob, hesitates, doesn't really want to do this, but doesn't stop himself either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spins it open.  Halfway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just sending a message.  She'll get the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gas HISSES through the spigot and into the hose.  We foll along the length of the hose, across the floor of the roo through the hole in the sheetrock, into the hole that's b drilled in the air duct --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- through the wall itself, where we see the horizontal l of an air vent up ahead.  We squeeze between two of the horizontal lines --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and come out in the panic room.  Three red streamers, to the air vent, flap to life as the gas HISSES into the panic room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Directly underneath the vent, Meg is hunched up against t wall, her arm around Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sniffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sniffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up.  Sees the streamers floating above her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaps to her feet, steps up onto a shelf, and stretch her nose toward the streamers.  Just as she does --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near the tank, Raoul shoves Burnham out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ain't playin', here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cranks the valve handle of the grill open all the way. The gas pours into the hose with an audible WHOOSH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg, at the vent, falls back, two lungfuls of propane, an drops to her knees on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, what, what is it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the floor!  Get on the floor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Sarah coughs.  The gas is pouring into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul is standing guard over the tank, to make sure no on messes with the valve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, don't be stupid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior has his head pressed against the door to the panic room, trying to hear any sounds from within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're trying to scare them, not kill them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna die in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody is gonna die, man, will you please have the balls to follow through with a good idea?  Think about it, what would you do if you were them, stay in there and choke to death, or come out?!  Huh?  We're just getting them to come out for forty-five minutes, forty-five fucking minutes!  The worst that's gonna happen is they pass out, we drag 'em out here into the fresh air, and they'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior, you gigantic idiot, how are we supposed to get into the room if they pass out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.  Junior turns to Raoul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it back a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fucking way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right, we can't get into the room if they're dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg and Sarah are down on the floor, rags covering their mouths, trying like crazy to filter the air, but it's not working.  Sarah is crawling around the base of the wall, to where she was before, clawing at the strange portal th again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, she finds a small metal handle, folded back into clover-leaf seal on the portal.  She unfolds it, twists i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The portal cranks open, revealing it to be at the end of tube, about a foot long, an emergency ventilation source directly through to the exterior of the house.  She bends down and looks through it.  It's covered by a metal mesh the opposite end, but she can see and smell the outside through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits up, gestures to her mother to bend down next to She does, and they both jam their mouths up near the end the tube, gulping fresh air greedily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg looks at Sarah, good job, and they both drop to the f at the portal and suck air.  It's temporary, but it works

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the master bedroom, the debate has turned physical. Burnham lunges across the room at Raoul, to get his hands the valve, to turn off the gas.  But Raoul catches him an hurls him aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham SLAMS into the wall, bounces off and SCREAMS at Raoul, who SCREAMS right back.  Junior leaps into the mid trying to break it up, to get them to shut up, keep their voices down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bedlam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the panic room, Meg knows this can't go on forever.  S turns away from the portal, looks up at the vent, where t streamers still stream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks to the other side of the room, to where Sarah f the waterproof matches and lighters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks.  Takes a deep lungful of fresh air from the t and crawls over to the lighters.  She selects one, snatch up a screwdriver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah looks at her, has a vague idea of what she's thinki but can't believe it.  She shakes her head vehemently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
