dialogues.text: In response, Meg picks up two or three of the fireproof blankets and piles them over Sarah, right up to her disbelieving eyes.  She bends down, takes another gulp of air.  but she's getting woozy.  This can't go on much lon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She staggers across the room, hoists herself back up onto shelf she stood on before, and gets right up next to the vent.  Holding her breath to avoid breathing the toxic ga she unscrews the vent cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The duct is wide enough to put your arm in.  She reaches past a bundle of multicolored wires that run down through wall.  She reaches all the way in, lighter in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we see her hand crawl in, lighter clenched between her fingers.  She raises a thumb to the flint wheel, cranks i once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too slow.  Not even a spark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her hand shakes.  She tries again.  Still no spark.  But the effort and the angle, when she thumbs the lighter it makes her hand twitch, banging up against the sides of th duct with a hollow BOOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham turns abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns around.  They all freeze, listening.  He hears i again.  The hollow BOOM, coming from inside the wall.  No third time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks forward, slowly, toward the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves closer, gets right up next to the wall.  He lean into the wall, putting his ear right up next to the air d This close, he hears the sound in more detail, realizes i two sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He arches an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg's hand is trembling, tiring.  She tries again, thumbs flint wheel.  It SCRATCHES as it rolls, her hand twitches BOOMS against the side of the duct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still, the gas HISSES through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg's face is turning color, she's running out of air.  H feet tremble on the shelf, she's about to lose her footin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: she tries again.  SCRATCH.  BOOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham's eyes suddenly pop wide as he identifies the sou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tears himself away from the wall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Meg's thumb tenses for one good hard turn --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Burnham leaps through the air, hurling himself toward propane tank --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Meg cranks the wheel, a spark sparks, a flame flames, a hot blue cloud shoots out in two directions, one toward panic room, the other toward the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg jumps off the shelf, throwing herself as far away fro the vent as she can, her arm engulfed by licking blue fla She drops to the floor of the room, covering her daughter body just as the entire ceiling of the panic room turns i a lake of fire with a deafening WHOOMP.  The fluorescent light tubes EXPLODE, showering glass everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the blue flame shoots out of the wall, into the hose, thr the hose, backing up toward the tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham CRUNCHES to the floor next to the tank, knocking other end of the hose away from the spigot just as the bl flame erupts from the end of the hose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flame engulfs his entire body, his hair starts on fir his chest, his arms.  Raoul lunges forward, Junior tears blankets from the bed and throws them over him, Burnham H and rolls on the floor in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the blue cloud on the ceiling suddenly evaporates with another angry WHOOMP, leaving a few little pockets of fla that Meg extinguishes by swatting with a blanket.  Only o of the fluorescent lights is left intact; it casts a flickering, uneven light on the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands in the middle of the still-smoky panic room, breathing hard.  She shouts, SCREAMS incomprehensibly, ma no sense whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops, noticing the look Sarah is giving her.  Wide-e admiring, frightened, you are an insane woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg looks to herself.  Her arm is signed, the hair burned off.  The sleeve of her T-shirt is burned back to the shoulder.  Her face is sooty, blackened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg GRUNTS, half frightened by herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out in the bedroom, it's worse for Burnham, who has lost of his hair and shirt.  But his skin isn't badly burned, which is something, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still, he's in a rage.  He POUNDS the metal door of the p room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'M COMING IN THERE, BITCH, I AM COMING IN THERE!  I AM COMING IN THERE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg whirls, goes to the door herself, SCREAMS right back. can hardly make out a word she's saying, but it sounds threatening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, she stops, hearing something else.  Outside the door, Burnham continues to rant, but there's a second sou a sound coming from the long wall of the panic room, the that's shared with the brownstone next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a faint -- very faint -- POUNDING sound, along with high pitched, complaining voice, so faint it can hardly b heard.  Sarah hears it too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neighbor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg and Sarah leap as one, facing the common wall, SHOUTI at the tops of their lungs -- get help, call the police, please, call the police, that sort of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shout and shout, but the soft pounding continues, an their voices are as soft on the other side as the COMPLAI VOICE is on this side, they have no hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their voices crack and they begin to cough, too irritated the gas to shout for very long.  Long after they stop, th soft POUNDING from next door continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their pleas are not heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Intruders have stopped their racket too, and are listening carefully at the common wall.  Eventually, the POUNDING stops, the complaining voice complains no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham stands there, in pain.  Things are falling apart. Raoul stands in the doorway, silhouetted by the hallway light.  He draws himself up to his full, bulky height.  H big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Junior) We're gonna talk.  Downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior nods and starts out.  Raoul lets him pass, but whe Burnham tries to follow him, Raoul puts a big hand on his chest stopping him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay.  Make sure she don't come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham swallows.  But stays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul turns, follows Junior downstairs.  As he descends, looks up, making eye contact with Burnham.  And holding i Something on his mind, that's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNK.  Meg's head falls back against a wall; she sags to floor, legs folded in front of her, completely drained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Sarah's not drained, Sarah's full of nervous ingenuit rustling around through the stuff in the panic room, an i forming in her head.  She finds a powerful-looking flashl and loads it up with batteries.  She tries it, flashing around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halogen bulb, very powerful, hurts her mother's eyes as s flashes it past.  Meg watches her.  What's she up to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah lays on the floor in front of the ventilation tube discovered earlier.  She squints through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: she can see out of the house, into the courtyard behind t brownstone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About thirty yards away she can see the backs of the brownstones on the next block, and directly across (becau the tube doesn't leave much room for lateral vision) she see straight into somebody's bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a light on.  A SLEEPING MAN is in bed, an open bo on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sits back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the flashlight, looks for a little button on th top, the kind you can flick the flashlight on and off wit Shining it on the wall of the panic room, she flashes it wall, three times, on and off.  Satisfied, she turns back the tube.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg, curious, crawls across the floor to join her.  Sarah shoves the flashlight all the way into the tube, leaving enough room on either side of it for them to see through. Meg lays down flat, squints into the tube, Sarah alongsid her.  She looks at her daughter, curious -- your plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah reaches into the tube, finds the little flash butto the top of the flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the piercing halogen beam begins to flash, across the courtyard and into the bedroom of the Man in the bedroom. The light flashes on the wall over his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flashes are in a rhythm.  Short.  Short.  Short.  Lon Long.  Long.  Short.  Short.  Short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg turns to Sarah, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morse code?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Dot dot dot, dash dash dash, dot dot dot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you learn S.O.S.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Titanic."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the flashes continue -- dot dot dot, dash dash dash, dot dot.  But the Man continues to sleep, the light on the wa behind him has no effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is frustrated.  She adjusts the flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the beam of light lowers jerkily from the wall until it i shining directly into the Sleeping Man's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah strains to keep the light in that perfect spot.  Sh starting to sweat.  Meg leans over, sneaks a peek at the watch Sarah wears on her left wrist.  The readout:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the Sleeping Man stirs.  Opens his eyes.  Winces from the light, which is flashing directly in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the Sleeping Man sits up.  Raises a hand, trying to block light, which keeps flashing on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up, out of bed.  He comes to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, yes, yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah keeps it up, flashing faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: they see the Man come all the way to his window.  He lean against it, cups his hands so he can see better.  The fla continue, right on top of him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly, the Man is reading the flashes!  He takes a step back from the window --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- gives them the finger --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and angrily yanks shut his drapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment later, the light goes out and the room is black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg and Sarah drop their heads to the carpet, defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah rolls over, knocks the flashlight away, stares up a the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg puts a hand in her hair.  It was a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're never getting out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at the wristwatch again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham is concerned as well.  He's still in the master bedroom, but barely, he's standing in the doorway, strain like hell to hear a conversation that Junior and Raoul ar having in the foyer, one floor one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're trying to keep their voices down, but stray words float up through the open stairwell -- words like "him" a "warning" and "dangerous."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham chews a fingernail.  If only he could get closer. throws a look back at the door to the panic room.  He loo back out the bedroom door.  Listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior and Raoul are huddled together in the foyer.  They keeping their voices low, but their conversation is heate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not gonna do anything about him, he's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you think I'm gonna let my half of the fourteen million bucks slip away because of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Half?"  What did you, take a nap in math class?  Three people, three shares, one third.  Four point six six six repeating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying, the man is a problem.  And he's your problem. Wasn't me idea to bring him along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Raoul, it wasn't your idea, none of this was your idea, it was mine, it's my family we're ripping off, it's my prick grandfather who built that fucking room, it was my idea to get the plans, I found the floor safe, and it was my idea to ask a guy who builds these rooms to help break into one!  Me, me, me, I, I, I, at no point did I say "you" or Raoul," got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his hands on me again I'll bury a slug in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you will not, because without Burnham there's no way in hell we're gonna get into that safe, so as far as I'm concerned he can paint your ass blue and run it up a flagpole and you won't lay a finger on him, you understand me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take no tone of voice with me, Homes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this shit you're talking all of a sudden?  You're a bus driver, "Homes," you live in Flatbush, so please don't start spouting some Elmore Leonard shit you just heard because I saw that movie too,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior and Raoul are visible, still arguing in the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the next monitor over, Burnham is visible, standing in master bedroom doorway, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg is watching the monitors, thinking.  She notices something, sits forward abruptly, looking at the monitor covers the master bedroom.  She squeezes right up close, staring at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we peer closely at the box next to her bed, the one she w using for a night table.  On top of the box, she sees the charger for her cellular phone, sitting empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg sits back, eyes alive with an idea.  If only she coul get to that phone, which must be still under the bed.  Sh looks back at the monitors, at Burnham lingering in the doorway to the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away from the monitors, to check on Sarah, who' settled into a corner of the room, looking pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the bedroom, Burnham is desperate.  The argument downstairs is entering round two, and he's got to hear wh they're saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a few steps out of the bedroom --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and comes into the hallway.  He leans over the stairwe Where he's standing, he is directly under the camera that covers the hallway --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and can't be seen on the monitor that covers the hallw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg turns back from Sarah, to look at the monitors again. She see Burnham is no longer in the bedroom.  And doesn't appear to be in the hallway, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at another monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: she sees Junior and Raoul in the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg sits back.  That leaves Burnham unaccounted for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the hell is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham is still lingering under the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah has come forward to the monitors as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but where's the third guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in the bedroom.  Do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg goes to the door, raises a hand to the green "open" button.  Hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we see Burnham, lurking in the hallway, just about six fe from the door to the panic room.  Don't open that door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg wipes sweat from her palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it looks like I can't get back, just close the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah nods, looks back to the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a shouted CURSE rises up from downstairs.  Burnham takes step toward the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he suddenly appears, in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAIT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg freezes.  She looks at the monitor, wide-eyed.  Close one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham can't take it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and takes off down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham flies down the stairs and appears in the foyer, n to Junior and Raoul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg and Sarah see all three men accounted for, downstairs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GO GO GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg leaps up, runs to the door, and punches the green but

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door begins to crank open, Meg slips through the gap sideways before it's even all the way open.  She darts ac the room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- slides to the floor next to the bed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and flattens herself, reaching underneath it to get th phone.  Damn, that phone slid far, it's right in the midd wouldn't you know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the three men hear her footsteps, as one, they take off f the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg continues to stretch, her fingers inches from the pho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: feet race up toward her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg's fingernails paw the phone, pull it closer to her. grabs it, stands --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the three men come off the stairs and race toward her, th see her as she lunges across, toward the panic room, she hurls herself through the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and Sarah SMACKS the red button.  The steel door close with a deafening WHANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the echo of the metallic WHANG reverberates through the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the panic room, Meg punches 9-1-1 on her cell phone wi trembling fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big empty charger cradle is in the foreground when th three men burst into the room.  Burnham stops in the midd of the floor, turns in a frantic circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd she get, what'd she get, what'd she get...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes fall on the empty charger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg raises the cell phone to her ear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and gets a rapid busy signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.  No, no, no no no no no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at the phone.  It's showing just one signal bar and even that one is flashing on and off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on, come on, come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks around the room, raises the phone high and low, trying crazily to find a signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the bedroom, Burnham stands just outside the door, fingertips lightly resting on it, the ghost of a smile on face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) I don't think we'll be talking on our cell phone from in there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the room, Meg doesn't seem upset.  Rather, she's staring at the cell phone in her hand, thinking.  Remembe something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wires...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the same moment, Burnham is having the same thought. still at the door, fingertips still resting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham looks down, at the baseboard below.  What is he looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg steps up, onto the shelf she climbed earlier, and com up next to the vent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw something, I saw...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the vent, alongside the duct, she sees the bundle of multicolored wires she saw earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... phone wires!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She jumps down off the shelf, goes to the tools, starts searching for something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may not have hooked up the phone in here, but I hooked up the main line, and there's a jack at the base of this wall outside, I saw it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that is correct, there is in fact a jack in the base the wall outside the door to the panic room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham bends down into frame, studying it, thinking the thing she is.  He clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, while we're on the subject of phones...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, looks up at Junior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I said cut the line, did you cut the main line at the junction box in the basement like I said, and which I repeated, or did you just cut the cord on the phone in the kitchen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.  Swallow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... hit a little snag finding the one in the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.  Then, as if a starting gun has been fired, Burnha leaps to his feet and races out of the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That same starting gun has been fired in the panic room. With a strong RIP, Meg pulls the whole bundle of multi colored wires out of the wall and drops onto the floor wi it.  She trusts it at Sarah, finds a wire cutter in the assorted tools, and gives her that too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strip 'em, expose the ends, try blue first, blue is phones!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue is phones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, no, I don't know, do 'em all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Sarah goes to work on the wires, Meg turns to the p itself, the one with the buried phone line that isn't wor yet.  She rips the phone out of its housing, tears free t wire on the end of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham flies down the stairs from the third floor, races across the foyer, flies down the stairs to the kitchen fl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham races across the kitchen floor, whips open a door heads down another, narrow, darkened stairway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg and Sarah are like animals, clawing and tearing at th ends of their respective phone cables, foregoing tools an stripping the wires with fingers and teeth, it's faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the phone receiver cradled on her shoulder, Meg star twisting the ends of wires onto the exposed ends of the w from the phone unit.  First wire -- nothing.  She tries a second wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham SLAMS open the door to a dark room, pulls the str on a bare bulb.  Burned out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without light, he can't see a thing.  He SMACKS the bulb, swings wildly, SMASHES on the cement wall.  He turns and races out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg tries another wire.  Still no dial tone.  Sarah shove another wire at her.  She tries again.  Nothing.  She mov on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham slides to his knees, snatches a flashlight from h duffel, leaps up and takes off again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another wire.  Nothing.  Another wire.  DIAL TONE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg SHRIEKS and punches 911.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham flies down the stairs, flashlight beam bouncing crazily in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone is ringing.  An operator picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 911 emergency --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at 26 West --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- please hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a mechanical voice, which gives over to MUZAK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham BANGS through the door again, starts searching th darkened mechanical room, shining harsh light around its dingy walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUZAK continues to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more time to hold.  Meg hangs up the phone, dials anot number, a seven digit one she knows by heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the mechanical room, the bouncing flashlight beam fall a metal cabinet across the way.  Burnham runs to it, flin it open.  Circuit breakers.  SLAMS it shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg listens as a phone rings on the other end.  And rings And rings again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is torture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham turns, sees another, smaller metal box, this one clearly labeled:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other end of the phone, a husky MALE VOICE answers clearly he's been awakened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me!  There are three --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a subhuman ROAR of anger, Burnham rips the entire ph panel off the wall with his bare hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With an abrupt SHRIEK, the line goes dead.  Meg pauses, c believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?  Don't... are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up, see Sarah looking at her, her eyebrows arch her face all hope.  Meg keeps her cool, but it take a hel an effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah reads her face.  She turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah goes to a corner of the room, faces away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll know we're in trouble.  He heard me, I said "There are three..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't even know who it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you think, in the middle of the night?  I mean, three what, three bears?  He'll call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just across the park, this is why we got places so close to each other, in case we needed each other, we're still a family, he'll help us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He WILL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She practically shouted.  Sarah drop her head into her ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying not to tell you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dizzy and thirsty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg blanches.  This is very bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired, Burnham drags himself back up the stairs and into doorway of the master bedroom.  Raoul and Junior stand th staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's never coming out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're never getting in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor and don't talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, what was I thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg has torn open one of the water packets and is trying get Sarah to drink, but the little girl has gone complete pale and seems to have lost some of the strength in her n she's having trouble holding her head up.  Most of the wa runs down her chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on... stay with me... you gotta drink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes Sarah's hand, checks her wristwatch thing.  The readout is now

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She swallows.  She grabs Sarah by the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, listen, honey, you went double digit here, you must have been shooting out adrenaline like crazy, we gotta bring your blood sugar back up, okay?  Can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dizzy, not deaf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, she's still a smart ass, excellent sign.  Did you see any sugar in here?  Any candy bars, anything sweet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you just gotta calm yourself down, that's all, just stay calm and your adrenaline will go back to normal and you'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I keep dropping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not an option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the bedroom, Junior has had enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man, after all we went through I am not walking out when we're this close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close?  Are you insane?  We're nowhere near close!  Fuck this, I'll make an anonymous phone call on Monday, they'll find the floor safe, and I'll inherit the shit.  Little piece of it, anyway, it's better than nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior thinks, then pulls out his wallet.  He thrusts a fistful of bills at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  For your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both just stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five hundred bucks here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither one of them moves to take it.  Junior shurgs, dro it on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suit yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Observe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads for the door, expecting Raoul to block him, but he draws close --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Raoul just steps out of the way.  Junior passes throug and heads for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not leaving.  I'm getting in that room, and I'm opening that safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lookin' doubtful there, Big Guy, but ten out of ten for attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he disappears, down the stairs, Burnham still pleadin with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg rifles the foodstuffs that are stored in the room. Sarah, in the corner, is starting to tremble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I spazz out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forced calm) No biggie, we've been through it a dozen times, I just jab you with the Glucogen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.  She keeps looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the Glucogen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you know, it's uh... it's in the little fridge in your room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) I'm sorry, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, quit apologizing, you're starting to sound like Grandma. You're not gonna have an attack. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lays back, oddly passive, her lips changing color.  S stares at the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior strides into the living room, purposefully.  He to some tools into his duffel bag and heads for the stairs d to the kitchen.  Burnham is behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you wait?  Would you please just wait a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Junior heads down.  Burnham follows.  Raoul is just coming down from upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior reaches the door of the kitchen, tries to open it, realizes it's screwed shut.  He takes out a screwdriver a starts unscrewing the screws.  Burnham stops at the stair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You walk out that door and you lose your share of the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets the last screw out, throws open the door, and BLA of wind gusts in, it's a blustery night out there, he tak step into the doorway --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and with a quiet PFFFT from right behind Burnham, a bu whizzes across the kitchen and hits Junior in the back of head.  He crumples, right in the open kitchen doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham SHOUTS incoherently and turns.  Raoul is standing there, two steps up, a silencer twisted onto the barrel o his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is staring at the video monitors, eyes wide.  She raises one trembling finger, points at the kitchen monito tries to mouth the words, can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham is freaking out, but trying to stay calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God... oh, my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul walks past him calmly, grabs Junior by the ankles, drags him back into the house.  He turns, looks at Burnha whose jaw is dropped in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should see the look on your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck did you do that for?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' asshole, thinks he knows me. Drives his German car up to 125th Street a couple of times, buys a few rounds, thinks he's a tough guy, thinks he knows me. (to the corpse) You don't know one thing about me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Burnham stares down at the body in shock and Raoul stares at Burnham, his back to the outside, a small, thin VOICE comes from the still-open doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the h --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn.  A man, fiftyish, stands there in hastily thro on clothes, staring down at the dead body in mute shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg, watching the monitors with Sarah, GASPS as she sees man, whose name is HARRIS.  While she and Sarah watch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- they see the silent image of Harris, set upon by Raoul who grabs him roughly and drags him inside.  Burnham hurr to the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and SLAMS it shut.  He puts his back to it, thinking, terrified, things are spinning out of control, fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul, in the middle of the kitchen floor, is venting som more of his rage on Harris, whom he has hurled to the flo He lands a solid boot in the side of Harris's head, leavi him GROANING in pain, completely disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harris rolls groggily into the spreading pool of blood co from underneath Junior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!  Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning on him) Who's the clown now?  Huh?!  Who's the fucking clown now?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls his gun, shoves it into Burnham's eye, hard, we hear the faint SIZZLE of skin burning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me.  I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burning me.  It's burning my eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul pulls the gun back, just an inch.  The skin around Burnham's eye is an angry red.  His eyes dart, strain to over at Harris, MOANING on the floor.  And at Junior, dea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?  Get us into that room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul pushes the gun barrel back into Burnham's eye socke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can.  You're full of ideas.  You just need to squeeze one out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got till the count of three. Then you end up like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tilts his head over to Junior, whose brains are spread out on the kitchen floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One.  Squeeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two.  Squeeze harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Th --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay!  Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got an idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Yeah, I got an idea.  I gotta check something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul GRUNTS, satisfied.  Pulls the gun back.  Burnham sl away, shaking.  He bends down, to the floor.  He looks at Harris's left hand.  At his index finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees a white strip of skin, where Harris wore his wedd ring, until recently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harris, still semi-conscious, is hurled against the metal door of the panic room.  He collapses at its base.  Burnh bends down next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, look.  I know you can hear me. Your wife and kid are in there. You're gonna get 'em to come out. Or --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up at Raoul, hulking overhead, gun in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or I can't stop what he's gonna do. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harris, regaining some semblance of consciousness, nods feebly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham stands up, turns to the video camera, and SHOUTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN THE GOD DAMN DOOR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah and Meg see the horrifying sight on the video monit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham SHOUTS at the door to the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN UP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: they see Burnham, standing over Harris; they faintly hear call to them to open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then they hear another VOICE, calling back to them. Sarah sits up, recognizes her father's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DADDY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harris is SHOUTING against the closed door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DON'T DO IT!  NO MATTER WHAT HAPPENS, DON'T OPEN THE DOOR! DON'T O --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's silenced by a vicious kick to the ribs.  Raoul begin beat him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham stands by, powerless, horrifies, watching as Raou savages Harris, who continues to call out, as long as he strength, telling Meg not to open the door, no matter wha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg and Sarah SHOUT in horror, she covers her daughter's face, turn her away from the screen, SCREAMS in incoheren anger of her own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she doesn't open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham SHOUTS at Raoul, pleading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STOP IT, MAN, STOP IT, THAT'S HIS KID IN THERE, HIS KID IS WATCHING THIS!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Raoul whips the gun up, into Burnham's throat, backin him off, shutting him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He resumes his pounding of Harris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham turns, looks up at the camera in the corner of th room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't stand it anymore.  He whips off his jacket, runs the camera, and covers the lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Meg watches, the monitor that cover the master bedr abruptly goes black, mercifully sparing them the sight of Harris's beating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds Sarah, who's sobbing, shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harris finally lapses into unconsciousness.  Raoul stands over him, chest heaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham stand in the doorway, neither in nor out of the r a silhouette, head hung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg tries desperately to see something on the bedroom monitor, but it's hopeless, it's covered.  On the hallway monitor, she can just see shadows, as two men in the bedr lift a third off the floor and carry him across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sudden BEEPING sound tears her attention away.  Still holding Sarah, she pulls her back, off her shoulder.  Her face is completely white, her lips blue, her eyes rolled into her head.  The BEEPING sound grows louder, she check Sarah's wristwatch, the reading is dire:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg GASPS, horrifies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah begins to convulse, she bucks right out of Meg's ar and falls back onto the floor of the panic room.  Meg cle everything away from her, tries to make room for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convulsion worsens.  Meg searches through the piles o supplies, comes up with a plastic-handled screwdriver.  S opens Sarah's jaws, wedges the plastic handle between her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She helps Sarah ride out the convulsion.  Finally, her ey roll back into her head, she slowly re-orients herself. Sarah reaches over, turns off her still-BEEPING wristwatch/monitor herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sighs, a shuddering sigh of relief, but she is nowh near normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her skin has passed through white and is turning a sallow yellow color.  She moves her lips, Meg can't hear her, sh bends down:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta jab me, Mommy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg turns, looks back at the monitors.  What she sees is news --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the jacket has been removed from the bedroom camera.  Bur and Raoul are gone, the only person there is HARRIS, who slumped on the far side of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg looks quickly over at the monitor for the living room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: she sees Burnham and Raoul having an urgent conversation, Burnham sitting in a chair, Raoul pacing in front of him, ranting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg's face lights up, she practically laughs, she's so overjoyed at this turn of events.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, looks back at Sarah, who is starting to trembl again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That does it.  Meg leaps up, hits the button that control the steel door, and it starts to crank open, almost impossibly slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg steps out of the panic room, into the master bedroom. She looks at Harris, on the bed.  With his back to her sh can't even tell if he's alive or dead, but first things m be first, so she turns and races out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg flies up the stairs, bare feet on padded carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the living room, Raoul looks up, hearing the pitter-pa her feet on the stairs above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles and pulls his ski mask back on, to cover his fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming around behind him, we see Burnham sitting in the chair.  Except it isn't Burnham at all, it's Harris, unconscious, wearing Burnham's shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if Harris is the person in the chair, that means --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the person on the bed in the bedroom is Burnham, weari Harris's shirt.  His eyes pop open, he sits up, sees the open door to the panic room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg races into Sarah's bedroom and tears open the door of mini-fridge.  Inside are dozens of little bottles of insu and something called Glucogen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs a bottle of Glucogen and a black leather pouch takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Meg nears the bottom of the stairs, she sees a horrify sight.  It's Raoul, ski mask over his face, standing in t doorway of the master bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SCREAMS, he SLAMS the door, she takes off down the ha reaches the end, throws the door open --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and races into the master bedroom, where Raoul is motoring, fast, headed for the panic room, where she can already see Burnham, standing in the middle of the open doorway, in front of Sarah, wearing Harris's shirt and a "tricked you" expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg hurls herself at Raoul, lands clinging to his back. claws and wrestles with him, gets one hand on his ski mas tears it from his head.  He reaches up to try to stop her from pulling it off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- his gun slips from his fingers, falls to the floor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and caroms off his boot, spinning across the floor awa from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul flips her off his back violently, she CRUNCHES to t floor, clutching his mask and getting a good long look at face.  He makes a move toward his gun, but she's faster, she's already pawing herself frantically across the hardw toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul measures the distance, knows he'll lose, and sprint for the panic room instead.  Meg turns, looks down at the medicine in her hands, then at the door to the panic room where Raoul is right now reaching up to push the button t controls the steel door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes a fast decision and lunges, hurling the plastic bottle of Glucogen and the black leather pouch through th gap just before --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the spring-loaded steel door SLAMS shut with tremendou ferocity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then it's silent.  Meg WAILS in agony, POUNDS on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands back, chest heaving, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A looooong moment goes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, a VOICE comes over the house's intercom system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) If you leave the house, we'll kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg sobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I see a uniform in the house, we'll kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg looks up at the camera in the master bedroom.  She no terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham pushes past Raoul, at the speaker button, and lea forward.  He's approaching exhaustion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into speaker) I just... I just need forty-five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul stands behind him, muttering to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw my face, man.  Saw my face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we see Meg's face, agonized, as she lunges toward the cam SCREAMING something up at it, the same thing, over and ov But in here her voice is nearly muted, what bleeds throug the walls isn't enough to be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul looks at her image on the monitor, irritated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we abruptly hear her voice, full-throated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting into the camera) -- cine, she needs the MEDICINE! GIVE HER THE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah shivers in a corner, knees pulled up to her chest, staring at the intruders, scared out of her wits, and loo very, very sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham looks at her, musters the most reassuring face he come up with under the circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be cool, kid.  Be outta here before you know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response from Sarah.  Burnham cocks a head, really loo at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up, for Christ's sake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham turns, grabs his satchel, and drops to his knees the middle of the floor.  Over his shoulder, we can see t face of Meg on one of the monitors, shouting into the cam begging them to give Sarah her medicine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using his hand, Burnham measures six lengths in from the wall, then digs his fingernails into the weave of the car looking for a seam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds one, gets hold of it on one edge, and runs his o hand along the seam till he finds a place where it seems turn a corner.  He stands, hovering over the carpet, and pulls back evenly with both hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The concealed carpet flap pulls back neatly, with the sof sound of tearing VELCRO.  Underneath the flap --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- is the smooth metal door of a floor safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham unsnaps his satchel and gives it a shove.  It rol out and opens up onto the floor, revealing a neat array o safecracking tools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins his delicate work, but is suddenly jarred by a POUNDING on the metal door.  He turns, annoyed.  Meg is s SCREAMING outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell does she want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, she keeps screamin' the same thing over and over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham turns, looks at the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg is staring up at the camera, miming the act of giving herself an injection in the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drugs.  She wants drugs.  What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Burnham thinks.  His eyes fall on the bottle and the leather pouch she hurled through the door, then whip over Sarah, who sags over into a fetal position on the floor. lips are moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crawls over to Sarah, puts his ear down next to Sarah' lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah tries to summon enough strength to speak, but her breath comes hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... 'jection...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An injection?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah nods.  Burnham points to the pouch and the Glucogen the floor nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah nods again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you do it yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah shakes her head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah looks at him, eyes pleading.  Raoul stands behind Burnham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't fucking believe this. (to Sarah) You gotta wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah just looks at Burnham.  Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, just like a half hour, maybe a little more, and your mom'll give it to you.  You can wait a half hour, can't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  She can.  She's fine, she's just like, tired, she's gotta rest. You rest, Kid.  Half an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah looks terrified, shaking her head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to pull Burnham away, but Burnham shakes his ha off, violently.  He bends down very close to Sarah's lips

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me the truth, okay?  What's gonna happen if you don't get this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah swallows, licks her cracking lips.  When she speaks it's breathy, almost inaudible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the words are clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coma.  Die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen from overhead, Meg paces in the master bedroom, out her mind with worry, no idea how to communicate to the pe in the room the desperate situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a VOICE comes over the intercom speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.  I'll give her the shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAND comes down into frame and picks up the Glucogen an the leather pouch.  Burnham stands, looking down at them. Raoul grabs him, pulls him to the far end of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wasting your fucking time, man, you're wasting my time.  You don't know how to do this, and the longer we stay in here, the more likely she's gonna lose it and call the cops!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gonna open the safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then shut up and get out of my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Burnham crosses the room, Raoul makes eye contact with Sarah, who is staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham drops to his knees next to Sarah and unzips the pouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, kid, all I know about this is what I've seen on TV, you gotta talk me through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah tries to form words, but she's too weak.  Burnham swallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  No talking.  No problem.  TV don't lie, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches into the pouch, take out a syringe, a sterile and a length of rubber tubing.  He takes Sarah's arm, stretches it out, exposing the underside of her forearm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem like a good kid.  Your mom... only saw her for a second, but, woah.  Beautiful, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.  Burnham ties the rubber tubing around Sarah's arm, pulls it tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, nod or something, show me you're still alive, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attagirl.  That too tight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah shakes her head no.  Burnham takes the syringe, sta to fill it from the Glucogen bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are pretty rich, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah shrugs.  While Burnham goes through the process of finding an exposed vein and giving the injection itself, goes on, as much to comfort Sarah as to comfort himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you don't think about that stuff.  Good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her, sees her looking at him.  Thinking about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know.  I really screwed the pooch this time.  I never did anything like this before.  Break into somebody's house?  Not even close.  Bad cards, Kid.  I swear to God, I been on the wrong end of maybe six straight years of bad cards.  House.  Car.  Wife. (snaps his fingers -- gone) Those are some seriously bad cards. And still, every time I pick up a fresh hand I swear to God, the rush comes so hot and prickly I feel it right down to my toes because this time, this one time, it might be there, this time it might be that hand, that perfect hand, that monster hand. (shakes his head) And you thought you were sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shot successfully given, he pulls Sarah's sleeve back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah nods, and she seems better already.  Burnham helps to sit up, to lean against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woulda been a hell of a dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VOICE comes over the intercom in the master bedroom.  I Raoul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's okay.  Now sit down and wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He CLICKS off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg is hugely relieved.  And extremely pissed off.  She g to the corner of the room and picks up the gun, the one t Raoul dropped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparks fly as Burnham goes to work on the floor safe with small, specialized drill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul bends down next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.  You saved her life for ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham looks up at him -- what?  But Raoul turns and wal away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham goes back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg is in the living room, with Harris, who is still slou in the chair.  He's in awful shape, barely conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the silence, a sudden, deafening sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOORBELL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes go wide.  She darts a look over to the door (the that leads to the stoop, not the bloody kitchen door downstairs), then back at Harris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasps) You called the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... scared...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.  This is exactly what she prayed for him to do, now it's the worst thing that could happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands, thinking, desperate.  She walks toward the do stops, thinks some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorbell RINGS again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes up with a plan.  She goes back to where Harris in the chair, pulls the chair back a few feet, out of vie the door.  She puts the gun in his lap, puts his hand ove to steady it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans down, WHISPERS to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.  Say.  A word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg takes a breath, walks across the foyer, tousling her as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul is staring at the monitors, aghast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit... holy shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham races over, looks over his shoulder.  One monitor covers the front stoop, and on that monitor they can clea see TWO UNIFORMED COPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's fuckin' crazy, she killed the kid!  She just killed her own kid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not her fault, it's not her fault, the guy must have called them.  Look, look, look, she's telling us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to another monitor, the one in the foyer, where is looking up at the camera, miming to them -- don't worr I'll take care of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gonna handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg's shaking hand rises up to the doorknob and pulls ope the big front door.  On the stoop, the two Cops turn to l at her.  She acts as if she's just been awakened.  She lo it, too, still in T-shirt and boxer shorts.  The wind is gusty and cold outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you guys -- what time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bout four o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop 1 looks at him.  Cop 2 stops talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody called you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd like to come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you can't come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop asking me that.  I'm fine.  Who called you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wake me out of a sound sleep at four in the morning and then tell me I look like hell?  Of course I look like hell, you don't look so hot yourself, Jack.  I'm freezing here, thank you for checking, can I go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop 1 studies her, notices the burned sleeve of her T-shi the black smudges still on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your husband says you said "There are three..." right before you got cut off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that phone call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop 1 takes a step forward and lowers his voice to just a a whisper, unconsciously making her lean forward in order hear him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am, if there's something you want to say to us right now that maybe you can't say to us right now, maybe you just want to make a signal, by blinking a few times, something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just looks at him.  Wow, this guy's intuitive.  She i sorely tempted.  But she can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's something you could do. Safely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks, thinks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and burst out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, you are good!  You mean, like, if somebody was in the house or something?  That's great, they really train you guys these days, don't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop 1 looks at her, not sure if he believes her or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm fine.  Cross my heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop 2 turns to go, but Cop 1 lingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask what the rest of that sentence was going to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stalling) Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sentence that started "There are three."  What was the rest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.  She stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, look.  My husband and I just broke up.  It's my first night in the new house, and I was feeling a little lonely and a little drunk. The sentence, if you insist on knowing, was going to be "There are three things I'll do for you if you come over right now and get in bed with me."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop 2 stifles a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But thank God I came to my senses before I said all that and hung up instead, so nobody would ever know what I was thinking, unless, of course, two policemen showed up in the middle of the night to interrogate me about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was good.  Cop 1 is embarrassed.  Cop 2 thinks it's funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want her to show you which three things, Rick, or should we just go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop 1 looks at Meg, a long look, he holds it for one last moment, trying to read her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we see the video image of the Cops as they turn and head down the front steps.  Meg closes the doors, looks up int camera, right at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham and Raoul breathe a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham goes back to work on the safe.  He's making progr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul looks at Sarah.  Stares actually.  He's thinking to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad thoughts.  He moves over, crouches down next to Burnh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She saw my face.  The kid too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah overhears that.  She raises her head, alarmed.  Bur turns, looks over at her, and she just gets her head back down in time.  Burnham and Raoul close themselves off, fo private conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah edges closer.  She overhears a fragment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's their problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is terrified.  Doesn't know what to do.  She looks her immediate left, sees the intercom panel.  She edges closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me fucking finish this so we can get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You finish.  Then we finish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sneaks up a hand and pushes a button -- "ALL PAGE."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the living room, there is an audible CLICK as the spea is activated.  Meg looks up, hears Burnham's voice, in th middle of a sentence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- posed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here with me, you're already on the hook for one.  Buy one, you get the rest for the same price. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid in here.  The other two when we come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg listens, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah holds the intercom button down with a trembling fin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how this gotta end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg stares, in shock, as Raoul's voice echoes in the empt room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stay in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There in an abrupt CLICK, and the speaker turns off.  Meg turns, goes to Harris, falls to her knees, no idea what t do.  She holds him close, their foreheads touching.  She' terrified, exhausted, wants to collapse in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead, she starts to pull the gun from his fingers.  He tightens his grip, what are you doing?  He tries to hold the gun, but she pulls his fingers off it, takes it away him.  He is too weak to resist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the panic room, Sarah has her hands clamped over her e her mouth is wide open, and a hideous METAL SHRIEK seems be coming out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the SHRIEK is actually coming from the safe, where Burnham continues to work, another drill, a bigger bit. noise is deafening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sees her mother approaching the monitor in the bedr carrying a jacket.  Meg tosses the jacket, this time she doesn't want them to see what she's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monitor goes black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the master bedroom, Meg pulls on a pair of jeans that hanging over a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps into a pair of boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shoves the gun into her belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here in the bedroom, she can hear the drill.  From the ho next door, she hears POUNDING again, more MUFFLED CURSES. Apparently the neighbor can hear the drill too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg looks from the walls of the bedroom to the walls of t panic room.  Her eyes light up with an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to the front wall of the bedroom, stands with he back against the exterior wall (street side), with her le shoulder against the common wall that's shared with the neighbor's brownstone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to step off the distance, heel to toe, measuri with her feet until she reaches the metal door that is th entrance to the panic room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hurries out of the bedroom.  What's she doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg comes into a small room full of empty bookshelves, a library.  There is a window that looks out over the sidew one floor up, same level as the stoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up, into the corners of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No camera, no camera, no camera...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're bare, no video cameras.  Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to the window, tries to open it.  Screwed shut, course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The safe is almost cracked.  Raoul is watching the monito carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we see Meg as she searches through the tools in the livin room, finds a screwdriver, a sledgehammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul furrows his brow.  Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg is back in the library, hurriedly unscrewing the wind She gets the last screw out, shoves the window up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind BLASTS in, it's a hell of a spooky night out the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans out the window.  We lean with her.  The sidewal empty (we see it only from our vantage point inside the house).  She's one floor up.  To her right is the house's front stoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tosses the sledgehammer over, onto the stoop.  Climbs onto the window ledge, and slithers out herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lean further, watch her as she edges along the ledge, down onto the stoop, and freezes, staring in horror --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- at the video camera that covers the front stoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we see her staring straight up at the camera, clearly standing on the front stoop, outside the house, where she specifically told not to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sees the image of her on the stoop.  Raoul happens be looking away at the moment, at the safe, but he starts turn around, to look at the monitors again --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and Sarah kicks him, hard, in the ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, away from the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  Can't control it sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul scowls at her.  Behind him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg darts down the front steps and disappears from view o the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sees her mother go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Raoul) Won't happen again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still leaning out the window, we can see Meg from here as reaches the sidewalk and runs up the front steps of the neighbor's house, which is contiguous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straining to see (yet stay in the house), we see Meg all way at the right edge of the frame, as she shifts the gun the back of her pants and knocks on the neighbor's door, sledgehammer held slightly behind her leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a long moment, we hear the neighbor's front door op The conversation begins.  The wind is gusting right in ou faces, we can't make out the details, but the gist is cle let me into your house, and don't as me a lot of question

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NEIGHBOR -- and by the tone of the voice it sounds li an old woman -- is slow to respond, grumpy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
