dialogues.text: Losing patience, Meg just pulls the Neighbor out of the w and shoves into the house.  The Neighbor stumbles out ont her front stoop, and we were right, it's an old lady in a nightgown, but she's no shrinking violet.  In fact, she's royally pissed off and not at all intimidated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do you think you're doing, young lady?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She storms back into her house, following Meg.  As both o them disappear from the frame, we move out of the library into the foyer, and move along the common wall, the one shared with the neighbor's brownstone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the other side of the wall, we can hear muffled voic arguing, Meg and the Neighbor shouting at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We drift up, up the stairs, and hear the THUNDERING of footsteps on the stairs next door.  We keep pace with the from inside this house.  We pass right through the floor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and rise up out of the floor in the master bedroom, an now we can hear the conversation on the other side of the wall in here, the Neighbor's fearful, angry tones, Meg's firm, urgent declarations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move with Meg, even though we can't see her, we know w she's doing, she's stepping off the paces on the other si of the wall.  We drift down that wall, fourteen steps, un we reach the metal door to the panic room, then we pass through that door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and arrive inside the panic room, where Burnham is thi close to getting the safe open, when all of a sudden --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham and Raoul freeze, alarmed.  It's coming from the wall, the shared wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody is on the other side, pounding like hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls are steel, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOT THAT ONE?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man, it's the neighbor's house, who breaks in through the neighbor's house?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louder.  Closer.  Burnham turns, SCREAMS at the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHO THE FUCK BREAKS IN THROUGH THE NEIGHBOR'S HOUSE?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got the Kid! (shouting at the wall) WE'VE GOT YOUR KID!!  What the fuck is she thinking?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got your gun, that's what she's thinking!  The FUCK you had to bring a gun for?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham throws himself back on the floor, goes back to wo on the safe.  Fires up the drill again, it SCREAMS into t metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POUNDING keeps up from next door.  We hear sheetrock away on the far side.  Bricks, SCRAPING out of place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah, in the corner, is energized, excited.  While Burnh and Raoul are distracted, she grabs the leather pouch, pa the three syringes that are left in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALMOST THERE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, the door to the safe CRUNCHES in on one side, yielding to the drilling --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- at the very moment that the head of a sledgehammer CRA through the wall of the panic room.  Raoul grabs hold of Sarah, Burnham maintains his focus, throwing open the saf revealing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sledgehammer head strikes again, opening up a hole ab a foot across.  Light spills through from the other side, well as the voice of the hysterical Neighbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul hurls Sarah against the far wall, leaps over to the side of the hole, and waits, poised above it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the safe, Burnham doesn't lose his cool, just opens a false bottom in the safe, revealing a manila envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snatches it up, RIPS it open, and his eyes dance as he holds up fourteen individual one million dollar U,S, Trea Bearer Bonds.  He fans them out, eyes drinking from his Grail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gunshot whizzes right through one of the bonds, setting aflame before it SLAMS into the far wall, sending up a li cloud of plaster dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESUS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He whirls, sees an arm poking through the hole in the wal gun extended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Raoul is standing just above the hole, and already ha his boot raised, over the hand.  He brings it down, a CRUNCHING blow that stomps right on Meg's wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg SCREAMS, loses her grip on the gun, and it CLATTERS i the space between the houses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the gun falls into oblivion, the space between the walls, where no one can get to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham shoves the loose bonds into his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I GOT THE MONEY, LET'S GO!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul grabs Sarah and turns, jabs the green button to ope the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them, Meg SCREAMS in anger and wriggles through th opening.  Before she's even all the way through, she gets hold of Raoul's leg and pulls herself into the panic room scraping and bloodying herself on the edges of the too-sm hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GO, LET'S GO, OUTTA HERE!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Raoul is deep in a violent rage.  Still holding Sarah with one hand, he bends down, grabs Meg by the hair, and drags her toward the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU KNOW HOW THIS IS GONNA GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FUCK YOU, I'M GONE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bolts out of the room, through the metal door, which i just finishing its slow crank open, its heavy spring coil in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul drag Meg across the floor by the hair, right into t track of the open steel door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up, sees the infrared safety beam over her head and  realizes with horror what his intention is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still with one arm holding Sarah, who is kicking and struggling viciously, Raoul holds Meg's head down on the floor, below the safety beam that would prevent the door closing.  He reaches for the "close" button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah raises her arm, stuffed with three syringes, and ja them into Raoul's neck.  Raoul SCREAMS in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg manages to raise her head, breaking the beam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the stairwell, Burnham, stops, frozen, his face twitch with indecision.  He hears the murder taking place just a him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs down three steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stops again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Runs down the rest of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul stretches to push the red "close" button for the do but he has to hold Meg's head down, out of the lower beam with one hand, all with Sarah savagely attacking him at t same time, and three syringes hanging out of his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, he gets Meg's head all the way down, onto the fl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking up, Meg sees the red beam become complete again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul jabs the button --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- just as Sarah throws her hand into the upper beam, the at shoulder level.  Sarah's hand turns red, the beam is broken, the door will not close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul ROARS in anger and twists violently, sending Sarah flying across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg strains, gets her head off the floor again, breaking beam.  Raoul starts jamming the close button, over and ov again, the beam completes, then breaks, completes, then breaks, never the button and the beam at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it can't go on forever.  Meg's tiring, she can't keep up, her head trembles --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and collapses onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beam completes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Raoul SMACKS the red button --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and Burnham appears on the other side of the door.  He reaches in, grabs hold of Raoul, to pull him off her, but Raoul loses his balance, falls forward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- into the gap --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and his head is crushed by the spring-loaded steel doo that SLAMS forward just as Meg draws herself back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg falls across the panic room, grabs Sarah, and holds o tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door detects the obstruction and opens again, slowly. Raoul's body slumps to the floor, dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham stands there, looking down at Meg and Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other, wordless, their first face to f contact.  She sees the bonds protruding from his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just looks at him.  There will be no understanding he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He zips his jacket, turns, and hurries away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham races down the steps, hurries to the entry door, throws it open --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and finds a gun barrel pointed directly into his nose. blinks, tries to focus on whoever's on the other end of t gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Cop, the first Cop, the one who came to the door was so suspicious of Meg.  The Cop looks down, sees blood smeared all over Burnham's jacket, sees more than enough know his suspicions were correct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your hands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham freezes, silhouetted in the doorway.  Wind and le blow into the house, a real gale outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind Cop 1, MORE COPS SHOUT, all at once, must be half dozen of 'em there, but Burnham can't see anything i the stinging light, and can't hear much either, over the ROARING wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham moves suddenly, flinging the door shut right in t Cop's face.  The door SLAMS hard, Burnham turns to run bu doesn't get more than a few paces before three sharp GUNS CRACK through the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brilliant white light spills through the bulletholes in t door, but it's not the light that gets you, it's the chun of lead.  They rip through Burnham's back and come out hi chest, a triangle pattern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham stops, sags to his knees.  He reaches into his jacket, pulls out the loose stack of bonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fans them out, stares down at them, holds them like playing cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monster hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, the front door CRACKS open, half a dozen COPS appear and start SHOUTING, all at once.  Burnham tosses t bonds to the floor, the same gesture as folding a hand of poker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He GROANS and collapses, slowly, falling through the bond twisting as he goes down.  He SLAPS onto his back in the foyer as the wind gusts through the open door, scoops the bonds up off the floor, and blows them back into the hous as if they were never meant to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham lies there on the floor, eyes open, staring up at ceiling, looking at the bonds that swirl in the blast of suspended there, twisting and bucking and diving just ove his head as he dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The swirling bonds melt into swirling leaves, blowing in air over Central Park on a crisp fall day.  The leaves fl down, over the Great Lawn, that massive expanse of grass saw in Meg's hallucination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But on a day like this the Great Lawn's full of people, throwing frisbees, playing football, lying there doing nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The leaves land on the grass next to Meg and Sarah, stret out on a blanket, a newspaper spread in front of them, op to the ads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg is on her back, arms folded behind her head, staring at the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is intent on the paper, circling the occasional ad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, uptown is close to Dad's place, but somebody at school said the Village is really cool, so... I don't know, it's so great to be close to the park and everything... What do you think, I mean, give me a clue, here, where are we gonna live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg rolls over, props herself up on one elbow.  She seems years younger.  She looks at Sarah, reaches out, brushes daughter's hair behind one ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.  She is calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind her, a flock of pigeons takes off, leaping into th clear autumn sky.
